fields.fieldDescription: The RID (Record ID) for the fee.
The Facility RID (Record ID) associated with the fee.
The Deal RID (Record ID) associated with the fee.
"The code that describes the state of the object during its life cycle (e.g. pending, awaitng approval)."
"The code that describes the life cycle category (e.g. potential, actual)."
The fee category code.
The fee type code.
Timestamp from when this row was created.
Timestamp from when this row was last updated.
User ID that created this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
User ID that last updated this row.  This is a foreign key to VLS_USER_PROFILE.UPT_UID_USERID.
The percentage rate that is applied when calculating fee accruals.
Indicates whether the fee will be paid in advance (or in arrears).
"Indicates whether or not this fee, once paid and inactivated, is to be re-accrued during ""as-of"" processing."
The fee performing status code.
ID of customer paying the ongoing fee.
ID of servicing group paying the ongoing fee.
Who receives fee payment. Use distribution list or lenders in a deal.
This percentage is multiplied by the real product balance to calculate a balance to accrue  this on fee.
The effective date of the fee (the date on which it becomes active and begins to accrue or amortize).
The code for the period of an amortizing fee or the cycle length of an accruing fee..
The fee rate basis code.
"For formula based fees, indicates the maximum amount that can be charged per period.  This field is not maintained and should be removed from the database."
"For formula based fees, indicates the minimum amount that can be charged per period. This field is not maintained and should be removed from the database."
"If the fee is assessed as a flat amount (rather than as a formula), indicates the flat amount to be charged each period."
The code representing the rule used when calculating the fee's accrual cycle end date.
The expiry date of the fee (the date on which it stops accruing or amortizing).

The float rate start date for the fee.  Governs the user's ability to manually change the Rate History for an Ongoing Fee (since all manual Rate History changes must occur before the float rate start date).
For monthly accrual frequencies, will determine if last day of month should be used or another day that is the last day of the month in some months (i.e 30).
The owner of the fee (facility or outstanding)
The type of the owner: FAC (facility) or OST (outstanding)
"Indicates whether or not this fee, once reversed, is to be inactivated
The Branch Identifier
